title: Badulla–Colombo Road restricted to one lane; further disruptions in Pahala Kadugannawa
byline: The Badulla–Colombo main road, which was blocked due to a landslide between Beragala and Haldummulla, has been restricted to a single lane, police said.

title: Trump touts ‘extremely strong’ China relations after call with Xi
byline: President Donald Trump touted relations with China as “extremely strong” on Monday following a call with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, who told Trump that Taiwan’s “return to China” is a key part of Beijing’s vision for the world order.

title: Heavy showers above 100 mm expected in parts of the island
byline: Due to the low-level atmospheric disturbance in the vicinity of Sri Lanka, an enhancement of the prevailing showery conditions is expected over the Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces during the next few days from today (25), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: IRD registers 200,000 new taxpayers amid highest-ever revenue collection
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has announced that a total of 200,000 new taxpayers have been registered so far this year.

title: Melania Trump welcomes Christmas tree to the White House
byline: First lady Melania Trump on Monday welcomed this year’s official White House Christmas tree, a white fir from a farm in Michigan that arrived by horse-drawn carriage.

title: Flood warnings issued for several areas due to heavy rainfall
byline: The Irrigation Department has warned that there is a substantial risk of flash flooding in several areas owing to the prevailing heavy rainfall across the country.

title: Cabinet grants approval to issue driving licences for Sri Lankans residing in Italy
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to a proposal to issue driving licences to Sri Lankans residing in Italy.

title: Chathura Galappaththi arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), Member of Parliament (MP), Chathura Galappaththi has appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), a short while ago.

title: Nine children killed in Pakistani attack in Afghan province, Taliban says
byline: At least nine children and a woman were killed after Pakistani forces bombed the home of a local resident in Afghanistan’s Khost province, Afghan Taliban spokesman Zabihullah Mujahid said on Tuesday.

title: Two suspects arrested over Rs. 35 million fraud case
byline: Two suspects involved in a fraud amounting to more than Rs. 35 million have been arrested following a complaint received by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID).

title: CID summoning Editor of ‘Aruna’ newspaper a warning to all journalists – Namal
byline: Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa stated that the summoning of the Editor-in-Chief of the Aruna newspaper, Mahinda Ileperuma, to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) is an act of suppression and a warning directed at all journalists.

title: Pope Leo to take peace message to Turkey, Lebanon on first overseas trip
byline: Pope Leo will embark on his first trip outside Italy as the leader of the Catholic Church on Thursday, travelling to Turkey and Lebanon, where he is expected to make appeals for peace in the region and urge unity among long-divided Christian churches.

title: Court official remanded for soliciting bribe from female litigant
byline: The Fiscal of the Udugama Magistrate’s Court in Galle has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Sri Lanka’s exports surpass USD 14 bln in first ten months of 2025
byline: Sri Lanka Customs data indicates that total exports reached USD 14,433.82 million during the first ten months of 2025, exceeding the figures recorded in the corresponding period of the previous year.

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka increase by Rs. 6,000 today
byline: There has been a significant increase in gold prices in the world market, and correspondingly, the price of gold in Sri Lanka has also risen notably once again.

title: Govt to introduce new digitalization system for EPF – Dy Minister
byline: The government of Sri Lanka has decided to introduce a new digitalization system for the Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF).

title: Pahala Kadugannawa Landslide: NBRO submits report, road could reopen after recommendations
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has submitted a report containing recommendations on immediate measures and long-term solutions for the site following the landslide in Pahala Kadugannawa to the Kegalle District Secretary, the Mawanella Divisional Secretary, and the Road Development Authority (RDA).

title: Air India, Akasa cancel flights after Ethiopia volcano erupts
byline: Indian airlines Air India and Akasa Air said on Tuesday they were cancelling some flights after ash plumes from a volcanic eruption in Ethiopia disrupted operations.

title: Fire breaks out at shop in Vavuniya
byline: A fire has reportedly broken out at a shop along the Horowpathana road in Vavuniya, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Australian Sen. Pauline Hanson suspended from Parliament for wearing burqa in protest
byline: An Australian senator who is campaigning for a national burqa ban was barred Tuesday from Parliament for the rest of the year for wearing the Muslim garment in the chamber.

title: No incidents of sexual harassment took place involving Parliamentary staff, inquiry finds
byline: The committee appointed to investigate and report on whether any form of sexual harassment had occurred involving a female employee of Parliament has determined that no such incident has taken place.

title: Cabinet grants approval for Sri Lanka to join RCEP trade bloc
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal for Sri Lanka’s participation in the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) and for the completion and submission of the initial questionnaire provided to Sri Lanka as necessary.

title: Cabinet approves amended Sri Lanka–Luxembourg double taxation agreement
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to sign the protocol amending the Agreement on the Avoidance of Double Taxation and the Prevention of Fiscal Evasion between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg.

title: CID probes reports that A/L Economics paper has been leaked
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has commenced investigation over reports that the Economics question paper of the ongoing G.C.E. Advanced Level examination has been leaked.

title: Govt to suspend issuance of new licences to operate analogue TV channels
byline: The government has decided to suspend the issuance of new licences for the operation of terrestrial analogue television channels in Sri Lanka.

title: MrBeast and Rockefeller Foundation team up to inspire global youth action
byline: One of the most storied American philanthropies is teaming up with the internet’s biggest creator to instill young people with a concern for what they call the world’s “most vulnerable” populations.

title: Superman issue found in attic by three brothers sells for $9.12M
byline: A copy of the first Superman issue, unearthed by three brothers cleaning out their late mother’s attic, netted $9.12 million this month at a Texas auction house which says it is the most expensive comic book ever sold.

title: Recently signed Sri Lanka-US Defence Pact made public
byline: A Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Defence of Sri Lanka, the Montana National Guard and the United States Coast Guard was signed in Colombo on November 14.

title: Cabinet grants approval to procure 3 million rabies vaccine doses
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to award the contract, amounting to Rs. 360 million (without VAT), to procure 3,000,000 inactivated doses of 0.5 ml/1 ml rabies vaccine (for human use) for the prevention of rabies.

title: Govt to present draft bill in Parliament to amend Port City Economic Commission Act
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to publish the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act No. 11 of 2021 draft bill in the government gazette notification and present it to Parliament for approval.

title: Former Chairman of SLBFE Mohammed Hilmi arrested
byline: Former Chairman of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), Mohammed Hilmi, has been arrested on corruption charges by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Former Chairman of SLBFE Mohammed Hilmi remanded
byline: The former Chairman of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), Mohammed Hilmi, who was arrested by the Bribery Commission, has been remanded until December 09, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: About 150 firefighters tackling west London warehouse blaze
byline: A major incident has been declared as fireworks and gas cylinders are believed to be inside a warehouse on fire in west London.

title: Two arrested over Modara Devalaya committee chairman’s murder
byline: Two individuals have been arrested in connection with the murder of the Chairman of the Ambalangoda Modara Devalaya Committee.

title: Energy Minister visits proposed wind power project site in Kilinochchi
byline: Minister of Energy Kumara Jayakody today conducted an on-site inspection and fact-finding tour of the land designated for the proposed wind power project in the Kiranchi-Veravil area of the Kilinochchi district.

title: Woman arrested in Moratuwa for illegally acquiring assets remanded
byline: A woman, who was arrested on charges of purchasing property using money obtained through drug trafficking has been remanded.

title: Five arrested over removal of signboards at archaeological sites in Batticaloa released on bail
byline: A total of five individuals who were arrested in connection with the removal of signboards at archaeological sites in Batticaloa District have been released on bail.

title: 2026 T20 World Cup: Sri Lanka grouped with Australia, Ireland, Zimbabwe and Oman
byline: The 10th edition of ICC Men’s T20 World Cup will start on February 7, 2026, with a total of six sides in action on the opening day, including the title-holders India.

title: UK minister flags visa ‘abuse’ as student asylum claims surge
byline: UK’s Indo-Pacific Minister Seema Malhotra has defended her government’s immigration proposals during a visit to India, while expressing concern about a rise in foreign students seeking asylum at the end of their studies.

title: Terror suspect in Easter Sunday bombings seeking asylum in UK – report
byline: A Islamist terror suspect questioned over the 2019 bombings in Sri Lanka is reportedly seeking asylum in the UK, according to British media reports.

title: President directs to formulate new laws for swift disposal of seized drugs
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that it is essential to focus equally on both the confiscation of illegal drugs and the rehabilitation of individuals who have developed an addiction to them.

title: Govt plans to limit rice imports and increase paddy production – Minister
byline: A discussion aimed at formulating a structured plan to resolve the issues faced by paddy farmers was held today (25) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Ukraine ‘agrees to Donald Trump-brokered peace plan’, US media reports
byline: Ukraine has agreed to the peace proposal brokered by the Trump administration, with some minor details still to be worked out, according to US media.

title: Over 700 families in 12 districts affected by adverse weather
byline: A total of 2,617 individuals from 737 families in 12 districts have been affected by prevailing adverse weather conditions in the country.

title: Indian Army Chief to arrive in Sri Lanka next week
byline: Chief of the Army Staff of India General Upendra Dwivedi is scheduled to embark on a two-day visit to Sri Lanka from December 1–2, marking a significant milestone in India–Sri Lanka defence cooperation.

title: Jakarta bans cat and dog meat to curb rabies risk
byline: Indonesia’s capital Jakarta has banned the sale and consumption of dog, cat and bat meat to curb the spread of rabies, the city’s governor said on Tuesday (Nov 25), marking a major victory for animal-rights advocates.

title: Financial allocation alone is insufficient to improve quality of education: PM Harini
byline: The highest amount allocated for education in history has been made in the 2026 budget, enabling the present government to formulate educational policies, plans and establish institutional structures for the sector, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.
